content:
Your tests/validators aren't good enough for this to be allowed in Reverse mode currently.

I just got this in a Reverse clash and noticed that I could get 100% on tests just by counting the number of opening and closing brackets of each type and making sure that they were equal, ignoring whether the opening and closing was done correctly e.g. ")({}][" would be ok.

The only test/validator that ensures clashers get tested for this is the final validator "Wrong Json bis.", which means that I ended up getting 75% after submitting.

You really need to add more tests/validators showing that the order matters, otherwise there's always temptation in a timed clash to submit the fastest code that gets you 100% on the tests, especially in Reverse mode.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: it's fun

Others seem to get this, so perhaps I am an outlier (that can/should be ignored) but my feedback is that I don't get it.  I have read it 3 times and don't understand.

For example, these phrases don't make sense to me:
~The goal is to know if the brackets is correct and return the opening/closing values of the brackets in a specific order.
~the order in which to print the number of their .... brackets.
~if the brackets are respected

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It was well designed...!

This looks like a good clash but I think it's too hard for reverse mode. you should also show some examples for false in the example cases. but this just looks to hard for anybody to solve in reverse mode in general.

I think you should change wrong json to have an extra "{" at the beginning. Currently, someone could write code that counts the number of each bracket without checking order. This is checked in wrong json bis, so I think it'd be nice if it was also checked in wrong json.

Line 2 is listed as part of the output, but sometimes you're required to only print one line.
If the brackets are not respected, I suggest that line 2 should contain the string "nothing".

Input section
* You have written "Line 2" twice. The second "Line 2" should be changed to "Line 3".

Constraints section
* [[openBracket]] should be changed to:
length of [[openBracket]]
* [[closeBracket]] should be changed to:
length of [[closeBracket]]
* [[message]] should be changed to:
length of [[message]]

Thanks.

I have changed it !
Thank you for your answer.
